Post's Title: The 3 most populous states are breaking coronavirus records, leading to fears of 'apocalyptic' surges
Post's Text: Florida and Texas announced Wednesday that they'd recorded more than 5,000 new Covid-19 cases the prior day, a new daily record. California reported more than 7,000 cases, obliterating a record hit a day earlier.

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: Why do you think Coronavirus has recently surged in some states? Bill Gates joins Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta for a new CNN Global Town Hall - Coronavirus: Facts and Fears. Thursday at 8 p.m. ET

Post's Title: Kids can carry coronavirus in respiratory tract for weeks, study suggests
Post's Text: Children may carry coronavirus in their noses and throats for weeks without any symptoms, which might explain how the virus spreads silently, researchers reported.

Post's Title: Wildfires ravage millions of acres in Siberia after record heat wave
Post's Text: Go There visits Siberia, where wildfires are raging across the region following an extreme heat wave induced by climate change.  More than 47 million acres in Russia have burned in 2020 so far, leading to air pollution that could further aggravate Covid-19 symptoms. CNN follows firefighters who are battling the flames, and speaks to a Greenpeace activist who has criticized the government’s response.

Post's Title: Trump claims administration is focusing on 'facts and the data' to combat Covid-19
Post's Text: President Trump, speaking to a crowd of more than 1,000 supporters who weren't socially distancing and many not wearing masks, says his administration is focusing “on the science, the facts and the data” to combat Covid-19

Post's Title: New coronavirus cases are down nationwide. But the US is still averaging more than 900 deaths a day
Post's Text: Compared to last week, new cases are down in Arizona about 36%, California and Texas have seen a decrease of 29%, and Florida's numbers are down 26%. But new cases are rising across the Midwest, including in Indiana, Iowa, Kansas and North Dakota.

Post's Title: CNN Business
Post's Text: US stock futures are signaling a flat start to trading on Thursday. But any gains would mark new all-time highs for both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq. Investors are paying close attention to a major speech by Jerome Powell, who promised to double down on the Federal Reserve’s efforts to boost long-elusive inflation. Shares of Abbott Labs spiked 9% in premarket trading after the company received emergency approval from the FDA for a test that can detect Covid-19 in just 15 minutes.

Post's Title: Pennsylvania governor calls for legalizing marijuana as part of Covid-19 economic recovery plan
Post's Text: Pennsylvania Gov. Tom has asked the state legislature to legalize recreational marijuana in an effort to help small and historically disadvantaged businesses recover from the pandemic

Post's Title: New CDC guidelines are 'ridiculous,' CNN medical correspondent says
Post's Text: “It doesn't make any sense … This is ridiculous,” CNN senior medical correspondent Elizabeth Cohen says as updated CDC guidelines now say people exposed to coronavirus may not need to be tested. The CDC did not explain the change, and many doctors were puzzled by it. https://cnn.it/31vhkUt

Post's Title: A mother captured an emotional photo of her son crying in virtual class to show difficulties of distance learning during pandemic
Post's Text: The 5-year-old was so frustrated with the remote back-to-school experience, that he put his head down and cried.   "I just took that picture because I wanted people to see reality," his mother said. "And then he came over and we hugged and I was crying right along with him."

Post's Title: Updated CDC guidelines now say people exposed to coronavirus may not need to be tested
Post's Text: In a shift that perplexed some doctors, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has changed its Covid-19 testing guidelines to say some people without symptoms may not need to be tested, even if they've been in close contact with someone known to have the virus. Dr. Sanjay Gupta is here to answer your questions about coronavirus. What would you like to ask?

Post's Title: Citizens around the world are stepping up to feed others during Covid-19
Post's Text: The coronavirus pandemic has been disproportionately affecting the poorest and the hungriest across the globe. With aid organizations and governments overwhelmed, everyday citizens have been the ones stepping up and stepping in.   Join CNN’s Arwa Damon as she speaks with three individuals in Nigeria, Pakistan, and Ukraine to understand how they are getting food to others during the pandemic.

Post's Title: Pope says gossip is a 'plague worse than Covid'
Post's Text: Pope Francis has once again condemned gossip, describing it as a "plague worse than Covid," during his Sunday prayers.

Post's Title: Wear a mask during sex, Canada's top doctor advises
Post's Text: Sex in a pandemic can be complicated, Canada's lead medical doctor says, and it's best to skip kissing and perhaps wear a mask to prevent spreading Covid-19.

Post's Title: Trump coronavirus adviser says Covid-19 model is 'ridiculous.' But it's actually been accurate.
Post's Text: An influential model that projects 410,000 deaths by January 1 “is ridiculous in many ways,” White House coronavirus adviser Dr. Scott Atlas tells Michael Smerconish.  The model has been accurate, with actual numbers higher, over the past few months, CNN found. https://cnn.it/2ESwyuw

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: She’s the longest reigning monarch in British History. And Queen Elizabeth is still making her mark with a historic address during the pandemic. Go inside her world in the final episodes of #TheWindsorsCNN, Sunday at 9 p.m. ET/PT

Post's Title: Laid off and now evicted amid Covid-19, a Houston father contemplates homelessness in a pandemic
Post's Text: 30 to 40 million Americans are on the edge of eviction. This Houston dad just became one of the many homeless in a pandemic.

Post's Title: 52% of young adults in the US are living with their parents. That's the highest share since the Great Depression
Post's Text: The number of American young adults living with their parents is at or near an all-time high, and the coronavirus pandemic is likely the reason, according to a new analysis.

Post's Title: Schools open across Europe, even as coronavirus cases surge
Post's Text: As coronavirus cases surge in Europe, Go There heads to three countries preparing to send students back to school after months of lockdown and closures due to Covid-19.  CNN’s Scott McLean reports from a school in southern England on the very first day back, Atika Shubert covers private vs. public schools in Madrid ahead of reopening next week, and Melissa Bell speaks to three high schoolers in France who are keen to get back into the classroom.

Post's Title: Russia's Covid-19 vaccine generated an immune response, study says
Post's Text: In the Phase 1 and 2 studies of the vaccine, which is named Sputnik V, all 76 study participants developed antibodies to the virus that causes Covid-19, according to Friday's report in The Lancet.

Post's Title: US adds 1.4 million jobs in August, but is still down 11.5 million jobs since Covid hit
Post's Text: JUST IN: In line with expectations, another 1.4 million jobs were added to the US economy in August as the jobs recovery continued to slow. America is still down 11.5 million jobs from February.

Post's Title: The US coronavirus death toll is projected to reach 410,000 in the next 4 months if mask use wanes
Post's Text: University of Washington's Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation expects the death rate could reach an unprecedented 3,000 a day by December, due in part to "declining vigilance of the public."

Post's Title: Trump puts pressure on FDA for coronavirus silver bullet ahead of Election Day
Post's Text: Trump has consistently pressed officials to speed up their timeline for developing a vaccine, administration officials said, saying the President appeared intent on being able to deliver at least the solid promise of an effective vaccine by the time he faces reelection

Post's Title: Why Latinos in California are being hit hard by Covid-19
Post's Text: Latinos make up 39% of California's population but nearly 50% of the state's Covid-19 deaths

Post's Title: With gun violence surging in Chicago, this group is trying to stop shootings before they happen
Post's Text: Go There heads to Chicago, where a “perfect storm” of coronavirus, record unemployment, and financial and emotional strain have led to a spike in gun violence this summer.  CNN’s Omar Jimenez speaks to a group working to prevent shootings by providing conflict mediators who deescalate disputes before they turn deadly.

Post's Title: The US detained hundreds of migrant children in hotels as the pandemic flared
Post's Text: Hundreds of migrant children have been held in hotels and guarded by government contractors in recent months as part of a secretive new system that advocates warn puts kids in danger

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: As families try to navigate school amid a deadly pandemic, Sesame Street and CNN are teaming up for a new town hall on "The ABCs of Back to School," airing at 10 a.m. ET Saturday, September 12

Post's Title: The first known Covid-19 death linked to the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally is in Minnesota
Post's Text: The first known Covid-19 death stemming from last month's Sturgis Motorcycle Rally was reported in Minnesota, the state's health department said.

Post's Title: Experts warn Covid-19 cases could surge after the Labor Day long weekend
Post's Text: After Memorial Day and the Fourth of July, the United States saw a surge in Covid-19 cases, worrying many that the same may happen again after the upcoming Labor Day weekend. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta is live reminding us that the virus is still prevalent and offering ways to have a relaxing weekend, while also taking precautions. What questions do you have for him?

Post's Title: How two European cities are taking extra measures to prevent a second wave of Covid-19
Post's Text: Go There travels to Europe, where several cities are working diligently to get ahead of a potential second wave of coronavirus infections. CNN’s Melissa Bell reports alongside police officers enforcing masks in Marseille, France, while Atika Shubert covers the implementation of mass testing locations in Madrid, Spain.

Post's Title: Researchers develop dog-like robot nurse to remotely measure patients' vital signs
Post's Text: Testing a patient for Covid-19 can be an unnerving experience for health care workers, but researchers are hoping to use robots to change that

Post's Title: A herd immunity strategy to fight the pandemic can be 'dangerous,' experts say. Here's why
Post's Text: Such an approach -- similar to what was pursued in Sweden -- would mean that many people nationwide would have to get sick with the coronavirus in order to build up a natural immunity across communities. As the virus spreads and sickens people, many could die in the process.

Post's Title: Task force reports show dire reality despite Trump's positive messaging
Post's Text: Data from the White House coronavirus task force released Monday shows President Donald J. Trump was getting increasingly dire reports about the spread of the pandemic in July and August

Post's Title: Analysis: This coronavirus timeline is incredibly damning for Donald Trump
Post's Text: To actively encourage the reopening of the country when he knew that the virus was extremely contagious is, in a word, irresponsible. And in two words, dangerously irresponsible. | Analysis by Chris Cillizza

Post's Title: Teachers fearful as they prepare for new school year: “I’m dying to teach, I just don’t want to die teaching."
Post's Text: Many teachers say they feel their designation by the White House as "essential workers" is now forcing them to choose between their lives and their livelihoods. As one educator told us: “I’m dying to teach, I just don’t want to die teaching.”  Go There continues to focus on education this week by traveling to New Jersey, Tennessee, and New York to follow three teachers struggling to accommodate ever-changing Covid-19 rules – all while trying to connect with their incoming students.

Post's Title: One month into school year, Covid-19 cases among Florida children jumped 26%
Post's Text: Since many Florida public schools opened about a month ago, the number of children under 18 who have contracted Covid-19 statewide has jumped 26%, according to state data.  But the state has still not released specific school data, CNN's Rosa Flores reports. https://cnn.it/2FED2x3

Post's Title: College students say they're anxious and overwhelmed as Covid cases rise on campus
Post's Text: Colleges are fast becoming Covid hotspots around the country, with thousands of cases being traced to universities and leading many to shut down entirely and others to quarantine students on campus. In many cases, anxious and confused first-time students are still moving in with new restrictions in place. CNN heads to New York, DC, and Ohio to follow students as they struggle to adapt to unexpected rules and restrictions.

Post's Title: This process will determine how quickly we get a coronavirus vaccine
Post's Text: With talk of the possible availability of a vaccine candidate heating up, you might have heard the term Emergency Use Authorization, or EUA, lately. Here's exactly what it is and how it applies to vaccines.

Post's Title: CNN Heroes
Post's Text: Military heroes unite for a new mission on the home front. Jake Wood and @TeamRubicon are hard at work in communities across the country struggling through the pandemic. See them and other CNN Heroes in action right now at DCFanDome.com. #DCFanDome

Post's Title: Helping foster kids through the pandemic
Post's Text: "For those in foster care, and particularly those who aged out of foster care, this has been an exceptionally difficult time because a lot of their support systems have been removed."  May is #FosterCareAwarenessMonth and CNN Hero Danielle Gletow and One Simple Wish are making sure these kids and teens have what they need to get through the pandemic: https://cnn.it/2M9mGfF

Post's Title: CNN's Brianna Keilar fact-checks Trump: He's 'lying about lying'
Post's Text: “The President is attempting some damage control. His version of that is lying about lying.”  CNN's Brianna Keilar fact-checks President Trump’s remarks after he admitted to downplaying the coronavirus. https://cnn.it/35yGYKJ

Post's Title: CNN Business
Post's Text: Stocks are set to open higher Friday, closing out a short and volatile week of trading on Wall Street. Consumer prices rose more than expected in August, news that might raise some inflation alarm bells. Peloton is soaring after the company reported its first quarterly profit and strong sales of its high-end exercise bikes. Supermarket chain Kroger also reported healthy earnings as consumers continue to hunker down at home and buy more food during the pandemic.

Post's Title: Fact check: Trump lies that he didn't lie about the coronavirus
Post's Text: President Donald Trump was asked directly on Thursday why he lied to the American people about the coronavirus pandemic.  The beginning of Trump's response: "I didn't lie."

Post's Title: Michigan rally shows that Trump 'doesn't care,' epidemiologist says
Post's Text: President Trump held a campaign rally in Michigan last night — where many people didn’t wear masks or practice social distancing — despite revelations that he admitted to downplaying the true threat of coronavirus.  “It is deeply frustrated watch him consistently disregard the information he now knows and understands,” Michigan epidemiologist Dr. Abdul El-Sayed says. https://cnn.it/3bVhl80

Post's Title: NFL player charged with fraud in coronavirus relief scheme
Post's Text: NFL wide receiver Joshua Bellamy is facing a slate of fraud charges for allegedly participating in a scheme to use coronavirus relief funds for personal use, the Justice Department said

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: What questions do you have about the coronavirus pandemic? Leave your questions in the comments below and we will feature some during a one-hour special tonight at 8 p.m. ET.

Post's Title: Coronavirus cases reported on college campuses in all 50 states as social gatherings grow
Post's Text: As coronavirus clusters accumulate on campuses, experts are warning of a resurgence of Covid-19 cases across the country, in addition to flu season. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta discusses the implications of these clusters as well as his conversation about testing with Adm. Brett Giroir, a physician and the assistant secretary for health at the US Department of Health and Human Services. What questions do you have for him?

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: What are your concerns over coronavirus and kids returning to school? NIH Director Dr. Francis Collins joins Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta for Coronavirus: Facts and Fears tonight at 8 p.m. ET

Post's Title: Her father died of Covid-19. Listening to Trump tapes was 'a punch in the stomach,' she says
Post's Text: “It is a punch in the stomach for me and every single person who has either contracted the virus or has died from the virus. It is clear that the President lied to the American public ... It’s simply inexcusable,” says Kristin Urquiza, who lost her father to Covid-19 https://cnn.it/3hiLejo

Post's Title: Parents and other caregivers are more stressed and in poorer health due to pandemic, report finds
Post's Text: One-fourth of unpaid caregivers in America are feeling more stress and have poorer physical health while trying to balance work and family due to Covid-19 than before the pandemic, according to a new analysis

Post's Title: Los Angeles backtracks on coronavirus trick-or-treat ban this Halloween
Post's Text: Update: Trick-or-treating won't be banned in Los Angeles County anymore this Halloween but it's still "not recommended," health officials said

Post's Title: Laid off and evicted amid Covid-19: "We ain't got nowhere to go"
Post's Text: Go There heads to Houston, Texas to look at the impact Covid-19 is having on those facing evictions in the United States. CNN’s Kyung Lah follows a Texas sheriff issuing orders to evict, and interviews individuals suffering the loss of their homes – just before the CDC issued an order on September 2 to halt evictions across the country until the end of 2020.

Post's Title: 'It affects virtually nobody': Fact-checking Trump's continued efforts to downplay the risks of coronavirus
Post's Text: Hours before the US death toll from Covid-19 surpassed 200,000, President Donald J. Trump  was again downplaying the risks of the disease

Post's Title: Kentucky doctor who urged mask-wearing early on dies after 4-month battle with Covid-19
Post's Text: She is now one of the more than 200,000 Americans who have died due to Covid-19

Post's Title: Laid off and evicted amid Covid-19: "We ain't got nowhere to go"
Post's Text: Go There heads to Houston, Texas to look at the impact Covid-19 is having on those facing evictions in the United States. CNN’s Kyung Lah follows a Texas sheriff issuing orders to evict, and interviews individuals suffering the loss of their homes – just before the CDC issued an order on September 2 to halt evictions across the country until the end of 2020.

Post's Title: First Trump-Biden debate to focus on Supreme Court, coronavirus and race
Post's Text: The first debate will focus on a number of topics, including the coronavirus pandemic, the Supreme Court and the racial reckoning in the country

Post's Title: United States surpasses 200,000 Covid-19 deaths
Post's Text: "Some stunningly sad breaking news," says John King, as he reports that "the United States, just moments ago, reaching a devastating milestone, surpassing 200,000 deaths from the coronavirus."  Dr. Sanjay Gupta details some of the many US lives lost to the ongoing global pandemic.   https://cnn.it/2RR0IkE

Post's Title: #RealityCheck: 'It’s American carnage,' Avlon says on US coronavirus response
Post's Text: More Americans died from coronavirus in about seven months than US soldiers in WWI or the Vietnam War. As the US approaches 200,000 coronavirus deaths, John Avlon puts the number in perspective. “This isn’t a success story. It’s American carnage.” https://cnn.it/2HoqCKz #RealityCheck

Post's Title: Bob Woodward: It’s ‘tragic’ that Trump gives himself an A+ in handling pandemic
Post's Text: “That is so tragic. That is a failure, a failure on his part to exercise the two pillars of responsibility a President has. First, to protect the people… Number two, to tell the truth to the people.” Bob Woodward reacts to Pres. Trump giving himself an A+ in handling Covid-19.

Post's Title: One country, two Covid systems: How China and Hong Kong have handled coronavirus
Post's Text: Today, Go There heads to mainland China and Hong Kong to compare how each has handled the impact of coronavirus.  CNN’s David Culver reports from Shanghai and Beijing on China’s efforts to fight the virus with QR codes and mass testing, while Selina Wang covers Hong Kong’s success in keeping case numbers relatively low without enacting extreme lockdown measures.

Post's Title: Updated CDC guidance acknowledges coronavirus can spread through the air
Post's Text: The CDC says coronavirus can commonly spread "through respiratory droplets or small particles, such as those in aerosols," which are produced even when a person breathes. It previously said that Covid-19 was thought to spread mainly by close contact.

Post's Title: Australia's coronavirus lockdown strategy worked. Could it be a model for the US?
Post's Text: On Sunday, the Australian state of Victoria recorded just 11 new coronavirus cases, down from over 670 at the height of the most recent outbreak last month.

Post's Title: 'Succession,' 'Watchmen' and 'Schitt's Creek' score sweeping wins
Post's Text: The Emmys went on as scheduled, with Jimmy Kimmel noting that an awards show might "seem frivolous and unnecessary" in the middle of a pandemic. But the host also pointed out that "right now, we need fun."

Post's Title: Study hints Covid-19 may have been in the US as early as December
Post's Text: Researchers believe they have found evidence that the novel coronavirus may have been circulating in the US as early as late December, about a month before the current timeline from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention shows

Post's Title: New York Fashion Week returns with socially distant and digital shows
Post's Text: The coronavirus pandemic has upended the traditional runway format, and in its place will be a mix of virtual and physical shows with limited audiences. Here are some of the highlights. CNN Style

Post's Title: A new Canadian Covid-19 gargle test 'one of the first of its kind' in the world, doctor says
Post's Text: Most children in British Columbia can say goodbye to those icky swabs and uncomfortable Covid-19 tests as the Canadian province launches a new gargle method for students ages 4 to 19. The B.C. Centre for Disease Control says the new test is just as accurate as tests using a nasal swab and is much easier to administer for children.

Post's Title: Student athletes face uncertain future as Covid-19 disrupts college sports
Post's Text: As colleges and high schools across the US struggle with reopening, many sports programs have been hit with budget cuts and cancelled seasons, leaving student athletes in tough positions. For high school students working to get recruited, being social media savvy has become the way to secure a college spot. For athletes arriving on campus, college is nothing like they expected

Post's Title: How Coronavirus could hurt low-income students for decades
Post's Text: As schools around the country reopen remotely, the gap between low-income and high-income education is becoming more apparent with experts saying students who don't have access to technology and high speed internet could be hurt for decades.  CNN speaks to two public school students, a RAND policy expert, and visits private school that is able to afford the equipment necessary to begin in-person classes.

Post's Title: Internal AstraZeneca safety report sheds light on neurological condition suffered by vaccine trial participant
Post's Text: The document describes how the study participant — a previously healthy 37-year-old woman — had trouble walking, weakness and pain in her arms, and other symptoms

Post's Title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta answers your questions about a Covid-19 vaccine
Post's Text: Get the facts on where things stand with the coronavirus pandemic and a race for a vaccine. Dr. Sanjay Gupta is here to answer your questions. What would you like to know?

Post's Title: Report noisy karaoke singers to help fight Covid, Philippine governor says
Post's Text: A provincial governor in the Philippines has set his sights on a set of people who he says are hurting the fight against the pandemic: karaoke singers.

Post's Title: Only the US has more coronavirus cases than India. But unlike Trump, its leader seems immune from criticism
Post's Text: Narendra Modi is seen by many as a "national messiah" who is working on a grander agenda to reshape the Indian nation along Hindu lines, and is not accountable for day-to-day government failures, say analysts.

Post's Title: Trump's not bothering to hide his political interference in vaccine push | Analysis
Post's Text: President Donald Trump's political interference in the scientific and ethical process underwriting the quest for a Covid-19 vaccine -- on stunning display on a chaotic Wednesday -- is deepening the damage of his disastrous pandemic response, writes CNN's Stephen Collinson

Post's Title: Americans over 30 have been drinking more during the coronavirus pandemic, research shows
Post's Text: Overall frequency of alcohol consumption increased by about 14% from 2019, the researchers reported in the journal JAMA Network Open. That increase averages out to about one additional drinking day per month by 75% of adults.

Post's Title: CDC was pushed to play down the risks of Covid-19 in reopening schools, former Pence staffer says
Post's Text: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention was pushed to play down the risks of the coronavirus pandemic in reopening schools for in-person classes, Olivia Troye, a former top adviser to Vice President Mike Pence, confirmed to CNN

Post's Title: Dentists are seeing more cracked teeth. Pandemic stress is to blame
Post's Text: Shingles, maskne, migraines and quarantine fatigue: The stress of the pandemic has manifested in a variety of physical ailments.   The latest evidence of this is a rise in cracked teeth

Post's Title: The US ranks at the top of the world's coronavirus death toll of more than 1 million
Post's Text: The global Covid-19 death toll has crossed one million -- and the United States accounts for more than 20%.

Post's Title: Italy avoids Europe’s second COVID-19 wave -- for now
Post's Text: Go There heads to Rome as Italy takes on new precautions to prevent getting hit with a second wave of coronavirus. Schools have reopened with masks, temperature checks, and staggered entrance times, while Rome’s main airport has implemented rapid testing for passengers. We follow CNN’s Delia Gallagher as she takes a closer look at the new steps being taken to protect Italy amid the pandemic.

Post's Title: Opening Bell
Post's Text: Stock futures are set to pop at the open Monday although there is no clear catalyst for the rally. Investors might be holding out hope that Democrat leaders in the House will come to an agreement with the White House on more stimulus from Congress following comments from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. In corporate news, shares of Uber are rallying after the ridesharing giant received an 18-month license to resume services in London. But drug company Inovio is plunging after announcing that the FDA is forcing it to pause a clinical trial for its coronavirus vaccine. https://cnn.it/2Hv66rw

Post's Title: Worried about more shortages, grocery stores are stockpiling goods
Post's Text: Grocery stores are stocking up to avoid another pandemic shortage

Post's Title: He lost his brother to Covid-19. Twelve days later, he died, too
Post's Text: Nicholas Gismondi was in the hospital when he found out his older brother, Ralph, had died from the coronavirus. 12 days later, Nicholas, too, had succumbed to the virus.

Post's Title: Johnson and Johnson vaccine produced strong immune response, early results say
Post's Text: Early results from a Phase 1/2a clinical trial show it was well tolerated and even one dose appeared to produce a strong immune response in almost all of the 800 participants

Post's Title: Former White House aide: I don't see Trump changing course on his pandemic response
Post's Text: "The President can call it a hoax, but the truth is we have increasing cases ... I don't see the President changing the course of the direction that we're doing in terms of the response to this." - Olivia Troye, a former aide to Vice President Mike Pence, who rebuked President Trump's Covid-19 response https://cnn.it/33Ymdpf

Stock market futures are pointing to a mixed open Friday, with the Dow and S&P 500 headed for slight drops and the Nasdaq inching a bit higher. This caps a volatile week for Wall Street, as investors grapple with concerns about a potential second wave of coronavirus and worry about the lack of any new fiscal stimulus from Washington. In corporate news, shares of Costco were down a bit despite reporting earnings and sales that topped forecasts. And biotech Novavax was set to pop after announcing plans to conduct a phase 3 trial for its Covid-19 vaccine candidate in the UK.

Post's Title: US still in first Covid-19 wave and should be prepared for 'challenge' of fall and winter, Fauci says
Post's Text: The US is still in the first wave of the Covid-19 pandemic, says Dr. Anthony Fauci, and flu season is coming

Post's Title: The number of Covid-19 cases reported each week in Florida has tripled since the state reopened
Post's Text: As the US grapples with the worst month yet in the pandemic for coronavirus infections and hospitalizations, Florida is nearing 1 million cases

Post's Title: Americans who traveled for Thanksgiving should get tested, White House coronavirus testing czar says
Post's Text: If you've done any traveling over the holidays, you should get tested for Covid-19, says Adm. Brett Giroir, the White House's coronavirus testing czar.

Post's Title: More than 91,600 people — the most of the pandemic — are hospitalized with coronavirus in the US
Post's Text: After a month of skyrocketing Covid-19 cases, the US has reached its highest number yet of hospitalizations due to the virus, with more than 91,600 people being treated in the hospital.

Post's Title: Sweden rethinks coronavirus strategy as it braces for a second wave
Post's Text: Sweden has been relying on a relatively more relaxed Covid-19 strategy during the pandemic. The country did not enter into a lockdown at the beginning of the pandemic, instead urging citizens to practice social distancing and good hygiene, but with the coronavirus surging again, doctors there tell CNN they are frustrated with the lack of tougher measures for citizens.   CNN's Phil Black reports from Stockholm.

Post's Title: The 'Golden Girls'-themed cruise was the pre-lockdown party I still miss
Post's Text: This is the story of going on a dream vacation on the cusp of a global pandemic.

Post's Title: Why Oxford's Covid-19 vaccine could do more for the world than other shots
Post's Text: If the questions over Oxford University's and AstraZeneca's Covid-19 vaccine results are answered and it receives approval, it may lead the way in providing vaccine coverage in poorer countries where it is urgently needed.

Post's Title: Covid-19 is taking a devastating toll on Filipino American nurses
Post's Text: Nearly a third of the nurses who've died of coronavirus in the US are Filipino, even though Filipino nurses make up just 4% of the nursing population nationwide

Post's Title: FAA supports first 'mass air shipment' of Covid-19 vaccine
Post's Text: The FAA said that several vaccines need to be transported with dry ice and it was working with manufacturers, air carriers and airports to provide guidance on regulations to safely transport large quantities of the hazardous substance in air cargo.

Post's Title: Covid-19 vaccine no 'walk in the park,' CDC committee told
Post's Text: "They are going to know they got a vaccine. They are not going to feel wonderful."  Americans need to be prepared for the possibility that they may feel a little unwell after they get a coronavirus vaccine, if one is authorized, members of a US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention advisory committee said Monday.

Post's Title: Supreme Court's scientifically illiterate decision will cost lives | Opinion
Post's Text: "The Supreme Court's ruling against New York state's decision to limit religious gatherings in a few high-incidence parts of New York City during the coronavirus pandemic will cause grave danger in the rest of the US," Jeffrey Sachs writes for CNN Opinion.

Post's Title: Family spurred to speak out after seven members get Covid-19
Post's Text: Seven members of a Minnesota family tested positive for coronavirus, spurring them to speak out.   “It makes you want to yell out and be on a mission to bring awareness to people … because we're already dealing with all the other problems that we have to deal with being Black in this country,” Charles Johnson-Nixon says. https://cnn.it/36eNmqp

Post's Title: How free testing could be the passport to flying safely during the pandemic
Post's Text: Go There explores what flying as a transatlantic passenger in the age of Covid-19 feels like. Last week, a United Airlines flight from Newark landed at Heathrow Airport as the first in a four-week trial by the airline in which passengers and crew are tested before boarding – offering them reassurance that at least at the time of takeoff, no one had the virus. We follow CNN’s Richard Quest, who was a passenger on that flight and filmed a video diary of his experience.

Post's Title: Separated from loved ones for months, nursing home residents face even lonelier holidays during the coronavirus pandemic
Post's Text: "I'm just waiting," says 76-year-old Grace Barnum. Fighting back tears, she adds: "To be able to hug again."

Post's Title: Millions of Americans line up at food banks on Thanksgiving
Post's Text: Families are lining up in historic numbers at food banks across the country as the pandemic exacerbates levels of food insecurity for millions of people. CNN’s Ryan Young is at Hosea Helps in Atlanta where they’re giving out meals to dozens of people. Many of them are there for the first time.   CNN has compiled a list of ways you can help the hunger crisis. Check it out here: https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/29/world/covid-pandemic-hunger-iyw-trnd/index.html

Post's Title: The pandemic is hurting gay and lesbian bars. The consequences for the community could be devastating
Post's Text: Part of the reason that closing LGBTQ bars is so troubling is that gay and lesbian bars have held particular importance in LGBTQ history -- and still do. They were often used for organizing and activist events. When churches didn't want to host LGBTQ people, they would congregate for Mass and worship at these bars.

Post's Title: More retailers are closed on Thanksgiving this year
Post's Text: The pandemic has transformed the holiday shopping season

Post's Title: Sweden rethinks coronavirus strategy as it braces for a second wave
Post's Text: Sweden has been relying on a relatively more relaxed Covid-19 strategy during the pandemic. The country did not enter into a lockdown at the beginning of the pandemic, instead urging citizens to practice social distancing and good hygiene, but with the coronavirus surging again, doctors there tell CNN they are frustrated with the lack of tougher measures for citizens.   CNN's Phil Black reports from Stockholm.

Post's Title: This 70-year-old left retirement to teach nursing students. She died from Covid-19 three months later
Post's Text: Iris Meda left retirement to teach nursing students "because she knew that the medical field was going to suffer due to Covid-19," her daughter says. The 70-year-old died from coronavirus three months later.

Post's Title: Shocking new video reveals Covid-19 in Russia may be far worse than the government admits
Post's Text: Go There heads to Moscow where shocking video depicts a hidden coronavirus crisis in Russia as the health care system buckles under the virus' strain. Meanwhile morgues across the country are reportedly inundated with bodies indicating a death toll that is far higher than authorities admit. CNN’s Matthew Chance reports.

Post's Title: NBA star Karl-Anthony Towns says he has lost 7 family members to Covid-19
Post's Text: The NBA star's mother, Jacqueline Towns, died in April of complications from Covid-19. On Friday, the 25-year-old Towns told reporters that six other family members have died because of Covid-19.

Post's Title: Americans used less gas this Thanksgiving week than any since 1997
Post's Text: Millions of coronavirus-wary Americans avoided driving during the week of Thanksgiving as Covid-19 cases surged across the country. That sent holiday week gasoline sales plunging to a 23-year low.

Post's Title: Biden unveils health team that will lead pandemic response
Post's Text: "This trusted and accomplished team of leaders will bring the highest level of integrity, scientific rigor, and crisis-management experience to one of the toughest challenges America has ever faced — getting the pandemic under control so that the American people can get back to work, back to their lives, and back to their loved ones," Biden said in a statement

Post's Title: Trump's pandemic blindness and election denial darken America's desperate winter | Analysis
Post's Text: "President Donald J. Trump's denial during his final days in office is darkening America's winter of sickness and death, damaging democracy, hampering Joe Biden's nascent presidency and jeopardizing Republican hopes of clinging to the Senate," Stephen Collinson writes.

Post's Title: UK prepares to give first Covid-19 vaccinations as the world watches
Post's Text: Vaccinations are set to begin on Tuesday, less than a week after the United Kingdom became the first Western nation to approve a Covid-19 vaccine.

Post's Title: A couple was arrested after allegedly traveling to Hawaii knowing they tested positive for Covid-19
Post's Text: According to police, the couple had been instructed by the Quarantine Station at the San Francisco airport not to fly and to isolate. Nevertheless, and fully aware of their positive Covid-19 test results, they boarded the flight with a child, police say.

Post's Title: Rudy Giuliani tests positive for coronavirus, Trump says
Post's Text: JUST IN: Rudy Giuliani has tested positive for Covid-19, President Trump announced in a tweet.

Post's Title: A Jewish doctor who treated a patient with Nazi tattoos says the pandemic has tested his compassion
Post's Text: The patient's skin was covered in Nazi tattoos, including a large swastika on his chest. Critically ill by the time he arrived by ambulance, the patient asked Nichols not to let him die.

Post's Title: Romney calls Trump's leadership on Covid-19 'a great human tragedy'
Post's Text: "The extraordinary loss of life is heartbreaking — and in some respects unnecessary," the Republican senator said

Post's Title: After working 256 days straight, this doctor is pleading with public to help halt Covid-19
Post's Text: "I do this day in and day out, and people are out there doing the wrong thing. ... in bars, restaurants, malls — it is crazy — it's like we work, work, work, work, work and people don't listen and then they end up in my ICU," Dr. Joseph Varon says.

Post's Title: UK approves Pfizer coronavirus vaccine for use 'from next week'
Post's Text: The UK is the first country in the world to approve Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine, and plans to begin distributing it next week

Post's Title: US reported more than 10,000 Covid-19 deaths in four days. The impacts of Thanksgiving will only make things worse, experts warn
Post's Text: "We have not yet seen the full effect of a potential surge upon a surge," Dr. Anthony Fauci told CNN.   And that surge will come right as travel and social gatherings will likely pick up again for the Christmas holiday.

Post's Title: Masks are critical to stopping coronavirus spread, even at home, CDC says
Post's Text: A CDC  review of what works makes it clear that mask use, physical distancing, avoiding crowds and washing hands all could help control the spread of the virus -- and would allow kids to go back to school and businesses to reopen.

Post's Title: California's ICU beds could be full by Christmas
Post's Text: Go There heads to California, where Governor Newsom has announced new coronavirus restrictions. ICU beds are quickly filling and the state fears that by Christmas they may be full.  CNN’s Sara Sidner reports from El Centro Regional Medical Center in Southern California.

Post's Title: Some Black and Latino Americans are still hesitant to take the vaccine. Here's what is fueling that distrust
Post's Text: America's history of racism in medical research and a lack of trust in the federal government is making some Black Americans and Latinos hesitant to take the vaccine

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: What questions do you have about coronavirus vaccines? Put your questions in the comments and we will feature some during a one-hour special tonight at 9 p.m. ET.

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: Dr. Anthony Fauci joins Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta to answer your questions about coronavirus vaccines. Coronavirus Town Hall – The Vaccines, tonight at 9 p.m. ET

Post's Title: Here we go again: The US could start losing jobs very soon
Post's Text: The job market recovery is at risk of stalling out as the pandemic intensifies. The rapid loss of momentum in the economy raises the pressure on Washington to do what should be a no-brainer: provide more fiscal relief.

Post's Title: Opening Bell
Post's Text: Stocks were edging slightly higher Friday despite a mixed jobs report that showed only 245,000 jobs added last month -- less than expected. The unemployment rate did dip to 6.7% though. Investors may be betting on more government stimulus and are also continuing to monitor news about Covid-19 vaccine developments. In corporate news, DoorDash raised the price range of its eagerly awaited initial public offering and the food delivery service now plans to raise $3.1 billion from its stock sale.

Post's Title: A 14-day quarantine is still best before seeing loved ones for the holidays, doctor says
Post's Text: The best present you can give your family is to stay home for the holidays, according to CNN Medical Analyst Dr. Leana Wen. If you must visit your family this season, the safest thing to do is to quarantine for 14 days to avoid giving them Covid-19.

Post's Title: Customers bought a struggling bar's entire beer stock to keep it in business
Post's Text: A Toronto bar owner says her business will survive the pandemic thanks to the loyal customers who bought up her entire beer stock, giving her a desperately needed cash boost. "People just started coming out of the woodwork, some people we hadn't seen in years," the owner said.

Post's Title: Opinion: How Elvis Presley can help us with a Covid vaccine
Post's Text: It made headlines and, critically, also helped convince teens and young adults — people who thought they weren't at risk — that they needed a vaccine too in order to help defeat the deadly disease, writes David M. Perry for CNN Opinion

Post's Title: Biden: I'd be happy to take a coronavirus vaccine publicly
Post's Text: President-elect Joe Biden says he'd "be happy" to join former Presidents Obama, Bush and Clinton in getting a Covid vaccine in public to prove it's safe. "When Dr. Fauci says we have a vaccine that is safe, that's the moment in which I will stand before the public and say that." https://cnn.it/2JCMTWh

Post's Title: CNN Exclusive: Biden says he has asked Fauci to be a chief medical adviser during his administration
Post's Text: President-elect Joe Biden tells CNN's Jake Tapper he has asked Dr. Anthony Fauci to be a chief medical adviser and part of his administration's Covid-19 response team

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: Operation Warp Speed has 100 million vaccine kits ready to go if and when distribution of a coronavirus vaccine starts, Gen. Gustave Perna, Warp Speed’s chief operating officer, said last month. They include a written vaccination card that looks like this. https://cnn.it/2Vxg0g3

Post's Title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta answers your questions about Covid-19 vaccines
Post's Text: Federal government officials are promising coronavirus vaccines soon —some even before Christmas — and states are gearing up to begin vaccinating Americans sometime in December. CNN’s Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta is breaking down what you need to know about vaccines. What questions do you have for him?

Post's Title: Opening Bell
Post's Text: Stocks are looking to edge up ever so slightly Thursday -- one day after the S&P 500 finished at a record high. But all eyes are on the job market and economy. Another 712,000 Americans filed for unemployment benefits last week. While that's lower than a week ago and less than what economists were expecting, it still is an elevated level. The report comes one day before the government is set to report the November jobs figures. Economists are predicting a healthy gain in jobs but that the unemployment rate remained at 6.9% -- as many Americans remain out of work due to the Covid-19 pandemic. In corporate news, shares of supermarket giant Kroger fell in early trading after the company reported earnings that topped forecasts but sales that didn't meet expectations. The revenue miss could be a sign that the coronavirus-induced grocery shopping boom is coming to an end.

Post's Title: What it's like to get an mRNA coronavirus vaccine
Post's Text: Here's what you can likely expect from one of the Covid-19 vaccines:

Post's Title: Analysis: Ex-Presidents fill leadership vacuum as Trump ignores worsening pandemic
Post's Text: Analysis: As President Donald Trump ignores America's slide into a tragic winter, three of his presidential predecessors are volunteering to bare their arms on camera to build confidence in the vaccines that could finally end the pandemic. That is what presidential leadership looks like, writes Stephen Collinson.

Post's Title: Lon Adams, who developed the recipe for Slim Jim jerky, dies of Covid-19
Post's Text: Lon Adams, known for developing the recipe for Slim Jim jerky, has died from Covid-19 complications on Saturday, his funeral home confirmed. He was 95.

Post's Title: Inside Santa School, where professional Santas train for a virtual Christmas
Post's Text: Go There visits Santa HQ, a new app that allows for video chats with Santa Claus. With meet-and-greets around the world canceled due to Covid-19, the app's creators have come with innovative solutions so that children from around the world can still meet Santa ahead of Christmas.  CNN’s Anna Stewart reports from London.

Post's Title: Inside Santa School, where professional Santas train for a virtual Christmas
Post's Text: Go There visits Santa HQ, a new app that allows for video chats with Santa Claus. With meet-and-greets around the world canceled due to Covid-19, the app's creators have come with innovative solutions so that children from around the world can still meet Santa ahead of Christmas.  CNN’s Anna Stewart reports from London.

Post's Title: This UK bar is posing as a church to get around pandemic rules
Post's Text: The owner says it's a tongue-in-cheek effort "to shine a light on the ridiculousness of the government's new tier system and how contradictory the rules are."

Post's Title: Opening Bell
Post's Text: Futures are pointing to a slightly lower open Wednesday following a solid rally Tuesday. Investors are waiting for more news on a potential stimulus deal in Washington and keeping an eye on Covid-19 vaccine developments. Shares of Pfizer and BioNTech were set to rally after the UK approved their vaccine for emergency use. In other corporate news, shares of Salesforce were lower after the software giant confirmed it is buying Slack for $27.7 billion.

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: Coronavirus vaccines are almost ready. What questions do you have about them? Join Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta for a Coronavirus Town Hall - The Vaccines, Friday at 9 p.m. ET

Post's Title: 'I couldn't save either one of them.' ICU nurse loses husband and mom to Covid-19
Post's Text: "Sometimes I'm grieving for my husband and then I realize my mom's gone. And I'm grieving for my mom. I just think ... oh, I'm going to go tell Dennis but then Dennis is gone," she said in an emotional interview

Post's Title: Florida becomes the third state to reach 1 million coronavirus cases
Post's Text: After 8,847 new cases were added Tuesday, the state has now recorded 1,008,166 cases and 18,679 deaths, according to data from Johns Hopkins University

Post's Title: Long lines for Covid-19 tests as Florida hits one million coronavirus cases
Post's Text: Go There heads to Florida, which now has 1 million cases as Covid-19 infections surge again nationwide. CNN’s Rosa Flores reports from a coronavirus testing site in Miami, and speaks to people in line as they wait to get tested after the Thanksgiving holiday

Post's Title: Coronavirus may have been in the US in December. That doesn't mean you'll ever know if you had it then
Post's Text: A new study published Monday suggests the novel coronavirus was infecting people across the US as early as December

Post's Title: After working 256 days straight, this doctor is pleading with public to help halt Covid-19
Post's Text: "I do this day in and day out, and people are out there doing the wrong thing. ... in bars, restaurants, malls — it is crazy — it's like we work, work, work, work, work and people don't listen and then they end up in my ICU," Dr. Joseph Varon says.

Post's Title: New coronavirus restrictions take hold as the world waits for a vaccine
Post's Text: Go There heads to China, Turkey, and France, where leaders are enacting new measures to contain the spread of coronavirus. Concern is growing in Asia as outbreaks puncture the relative calm, while France attempts to ease its second round of lockdown measures ahead of Christmas, and Turkey reimposes restrictions to bring down the surge. CNN’s David Culver, Jomana Karadsheh, and Melissa Bell report from Shenzhen, Istanbul, and Paris.

Post's Title: MacKenzie Scott donates $4.2 billion to 384 organizations, focusing on the underserved
Post's Text: "The pandemic has been a wrecking ball in the lives of Americans already struggling," Scott wrote. "...Meanwhile, it has substantially increased the wealth of billionaires."

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: The covid vaccines are ready, but are you ready to take one? Join Don Lemon and Dr. Sanjay Gupta for The Color of Covid – The Vaccines. Friday at 10 p.m. ET

Post's Title: It's not just doctors and nurses who are getting the first vaccines
Post's Text: The first Pfizer and BioNTech Covid-19 vaccines are here, and it's not just doctors and nurses who are getting them first

Post's Title: Your home is a hotspot for Covid-19, studies say
Post's Text: Coronavirus transmission is at a record high, with "crowded, multigenerational housing" especially at risk. Here's your checklist.

Post's Title: Analysis: A new vaccine and a soon-to-be president begin turning the page
Post's Text: "On a day of hope, tragedy and constitutional affirmation, the United States could at last sense eventual deliverance from the twin menaces of 2020: a murderous virus and a vanquished President's quest to extinguish democracy," writes CNN's Stephen Collinson.

Post's Title: Biden after Electoral College affirms win: 'The rule of law, our Constitution and the will of the people prevailed'
Post's Text: "The flame of democracy was lit in this nation a long time ago. And we now know nothing, not even a pandemic or an abuse of power, can extinguish that flame," the President-elect ssid.

Post's Title: Virgin Orbit halts test flights as Covid-19 cases surge
Post's Text: Virgin Orbit, the sister company to Richard Branson's space venture Virgin Galactic, is halting a rocket launch attempt because too many of its employees were at risk of Covid-19 exposure, the company said

Post's Title: Inside Venezuela’s desperate hospitals battling Covid-19
Post's Text: Go There heads to Venezuela. As Covid-19 sweeps the country, many who have been infected are opting to stay at home due to derelict conditions at hospitals – which have no electricity, no running water, and no hygiene. As one worker tells us: “If patients don’t die of the disease, they die of contamination.” CNN’s Isa Soares tours two major hospitals in Caracas and speaks to doctors who detail the dire situation of health care in Venezuela.

Post's Title: Headline: E554 A day in the life of a mail carrier during Covid-19 with cases on the rise
Post's Text: Go There takes a closer look at how Covid-19 has put a strain on the US Postal Service. With the agency understaffed and in financial crisis, employees are continuing to risk coronavirus exposure every day. CNN follows two USPS letter carriers in Michigan and Colorado as they attempt to do their essential work in the middle of a pandemic. This updated video clarifies how a move by Congress affected the Postal Service’s finances.

Post's Title: Federal database for Covid-19 vaccination info raises concerns about privacy and vaccine uptake
Post's Text: As Operation Warp Speed prepares to give the first Americans the coronavirus vaccine, states are set to turn over varying levels of non-identifiable information about vaccine recipients in order to help the federal government track the effort to eradicate the virus.

Post's Title: Meghan, The Duchess of Sussex on CNN Heroes: An All-Star Tribute
Post's Text: Meghan, The Duchess of Sussex, honors the people working to feed those in need during the pandemic on CNN Heroes: An All-Star Tribute. Get Involved: CNNHeroes.com

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: Elmo and Big Bird are back on CNN for the holidays! Join Dr. Sanjay Gupta and the Sesame Street crew for a brand new The ABCs of Covid-19: A #CNNSesameStreet Town Hall for Families, Saturday, December 19th at 10 a.m. ET.   Parents, submit questions to cnn.it/3qLdykK

Post's Title: With Congress stuck, states are stepping in with relief for residents and businesses
Post's Text: With hopes of additional congressional relief still up in the air, states are taking action to help struggling residents and small businesses as the economy falters and coronavirus cases surge.

Post's Title: Allergy warning for Covid-19 vaccine after two UK health workers suffer reaction
Post's Text: People with a "significant history of allergic reactions" shouldn't be given the Pfizer/BioNTech coronavirus vaccine, the UK's National Health Service advised after two healthcare workers had symptoms after receiving a shot.

Post's Title: Letters to Santa reveal the toll the pandemic is taking on kids
Post's Text: "I wish covid was over so we can hug." "Dad says that even though he lost his job we will still find a way to celebrate." "PS, I'm sorry if I've been bad. It's really hard because of Covid-19 and online school."

Post's Title: A 17-year-old lost both her parents to COVID-19 hours apart
Post's Text: Tony and Lisa Vasquez were high school sweethearts. Last week, within hours of each other, the two died from Covid-19.

Post's Title: Analysis: More Black people need to be part of Covid-19 vaccine trials. Here's why I participated
Post's Text: "Everyone is here in the pursuit of science to help end the coronavirus pandemic — everyone including me," writes CNN's Stephanie Elam

Post's Title: How to safely make it through the holiday season
Post's Text: In light of the latest Covid vaccine developments, CNN Medical Analyst Dr. Leana Wen explains why she's still being so safe and won't gather indoors with family outside of her household this holiday season.

Post's Title: Opening Bell
Post's Text: Stocks are looking to end the week on a down note, with futures pointing to a drop Friday morning. The lack of progress on the stimulus front is outweighing optimism about a coronavirus vaccine likely coming sooner rather than later. In corporate news, shares of Disney are set to surge and open at an all-time high after the company unveiled a wealth of new programs for its Disney+ streaming service Thursday. And shares of Airbnb may cool off a bit in their second day of trading. The stock is slightly lower after debuting on Wall Street Thursday with a 113% pop.

Post's Title: New Hampshire's House speaker dies from Covid-19
Post's Text: New Hampshire Speaker of the House Richard "Dick" Hinch died from Covid-19, the state attorney general's office announced.  Hinch's death comes as the coronavirus ravages the country, and he is among the 3,124 Americans who died from the virus on Wednesday, a record-setting day for the pandemic in the US.

Post's Title: How rural hospitals will take on challenge of delivering coronavirus vaccines
Post's Text: Go There heads to Sioux Falls, South Dakota. With the coronavirus vaccine almost ready for distribution, rural hospitals are facing a unique problem. Sanford Health in the Great Plains region needs to deliver the vaccine to a sparsely populated area that is over 200,000 square miles. CNN’s Omar Jimenez speaks with Dr. Jeremy Cauwels, head physician at Sanford Health, who discusses the various obstacles rural health systems currently face and shows us the equipment needed to store the vaccines.

Post's Title: House passes stopgap funding bill to avert shutdown
Post's Text: The House of Representatives voted to pass a short-term funding bill to avert a government shutdown at the end of the week, buying more time for negotiations over sweeping legislation to keep the government funded along with additional pandemic relief.

Post's Title: 42% of Americans say their income is still below pre-pandemic levels
Post's Text: Nine months into the pandemic, 42% of Americans say their household income is still below what it was before the coronavirus outbreak began, according to a new survey

Post's Title: Inside a UK Covid-19 vaccination center as historic rollout gets underway
Post's Text: Go There heads to the UK as it begins rolling out the initial doses of a coronavirus vaccine. Manufactured by Pfizer/BioNTech and reported to have a 95% efficacy rate, the nation’s frontline health workers and individuals over the age of 80 are among the first to receive one of two doses. CNN’s Max Foster reports from a vaccination center in Cardiff.

Post's Title: Inside a UK Covid-19 vaccination center as historic rollout gets underway
Post's Text: Go There heads to the UK as it begins rolling out the initial doses of a coronavirus vaccine. Manufactured by Pfizer/BioNTech and reported to have a 95% efficacy rate, the nation’s frontline health workers and individuals over the age of 80 are among the first to receive one of two doses. CNN’s Max Foster reports from a vaccination center in Cardiff.

Post's Title: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey donated $15 million to help fund program for guaranteed income to residents in need
Post's Text: While the economic crisis brought on by the pandemic has ravaged communities around the world, the concept of a guaranteed basic income has become increasingly more attractive to many, including Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey

Post's Title: Pentagon planning to prioritize medical personnel then senior leaders in coronavirus vaccine rollout
Post's Text: The Pentagon has drafted a list of the groups that it will provide the coronavirus vaccine to first, prioritizing health care workers and then "critical national capabilities," which will include the country's nuclear forces, elite military units and senior Pentagon leaders, according to two defense officials familiar with the list.

Post's Title: "We're nothing but pawns." Mexico’s factory workers making PPE speak out about the risks of Covid-19
Post's Text: Go There heads to Mexico, where factory workers making PPE are speaking out about the risks of Covid-19 they are facing. Huge factories called maquiladoras employ thousands of these low-wage workers to make critical medical supplies for other countries — including the United States. Already suffering from poor labor conditions, workers say that the pandemic has made things much worse. CNN’s Matt Rivers reports from Tijuana.

Post's Title: Highly endangered black-footed ferrets get Covid-19 vaccine
Post's Text: About 120 black-footed ferrets, among the most endangered mammals in North America, were injected with an experimental Covid-19 vaccine aimed at protecting the small, weasel-like creatures rescued from the brink of extinction four decades ago

Post's Title: Trump administration to purchase additional 100 million Pfizer vaccine doses
Post's Text: The Trump administration will purchase an additional 100 million doses of coronavirus vaccine from Pfizer, the US Department of Health and Human Services announced Wednesday

Post's Title: Klobuchar slams Trump after he throws Covid-19 relief deal into doubt
Post's Text: “Where was he? Where was he hiding out?”   Sen. Amy Klobuchar says President Trump should sign the $900 billion coronavirus relief package now so Americans can get immediate assistance. https://cnn.it/34Gvkfv

Post's Title: NIH director says he’s concerned about what’s missed by US coronavirus surveillance
Post's Text: National Institutes of Health Director Dr. Francis Collins says he expects the UK Covid-19 variant is already in the US.  “We don't have the kind of really rigorous surveillance system that would help us right now to find out what are the new variants that are circulating in the United States. … Ours is going to get beefed up now.” https://cnn.it/3hbORcy

Post's Title: In the Congo rainforest, the doctor who discovered Ebola warns of deadly viruses yet to come
Post's Text: The doctor who discovered Ebola warns of deadly viruses yet to come. CNN goes deep into the rainforest to explore the war on future pandemics. https://cnn.it/38sGjtW

Post's Title: Countries ban UK travel due to new Covid-19 variant
Post's Text: Countries around the world are once again imposing travel restrictions after a new Covid-19 variant was discovered in the UK. British authorities have also started to impose strict lockdowns across the country. CNN’s Salma Abdelaziz is live from Dover, a major shipping port where closures have led to gridlock on both sides of the English Channel. What questions do you have for her?

Post's Title: Opening Bell
Post's Text: Stocks are pointing to a flat open Tuesday as investors start to get ready for the holidays and wait for more news about the latest Covid-19 variant. The latest stimulus deal in Washington -- as well as hopes of more people getting coronavirus vaccines -- is helping boost sentiment on Wall Street. In economic news, the US government announced its final estimate for GDP growth in the third quarter, saying that the economy bounced back 33.4% on an annualized basis. Shares of Peloton are surging after it announced plans to buy rival exercise equipment company Precor for $420 million. And Apple is higher on reports that it is getting closer to developing its own electric car and battery, a development that could be troubling for new S&P 500 constituent Tesla.

Post's Title: Taiwan has had one of the strongest Covid-19 responses in the world. It just reported its first case since April
Post's Text: Taiwan has recorded its first locally-transmitted case of coronavirus in more than 250 days

Post's Title: Mexico factory workers making PPE for US face virus exposure and rising deaths
Post's Text: Already working under poor labor conditions, employees at Mexican factories manufacturing US-bound medical supplies say the coronavirus pandemic has made things even worse. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

Post's Title: Vatican OKs getting Covid-19 vaccines that used cell lines from aborted fetuses
Post's Text: Being vaccinated against Covid-19 is morally acceptable, the Vatican says, after some anti-abortion groups raised concerns about how the vaccines were manufactured

Post's Title: UK travel ban: These countries have imposed new restrictions
Post's Text: Countries around the world are imposing bans and restrictions on travel from the United Kingdom to stem the transmission of a coronavirus variant that health authorities say can spread faster than others

Post's Title: Biden receives first dose of Covid-19 vaccine on live television
Post's Text: "We owe these folks an awful lot," Joe Biden said, thanking those involved in the vaccine's development and distribution and front-line health care workers

Post's Title: Covid-19 vaccine is a source of hope for health care workers. But it comes too late for hundreds of them
Post's Text: More than 240,000 health care workers have been infected with coronavirus and nearly 900 have died, according to the CDC. For their families — and those of the more than 300,000 Americans who have died from Covid-19 — the long-awaited vaccine is a source of hope in a year of despair.

Post's Title: What we know -- and what we don't -- about the UK coronavirus variant
Post's Text: The United Kingdom has identified a new, potentially more contagious coronavirus variant linked to a recent surge in cases in England. Here's what you need to know.

Post's Title: Opening Bell
Post's Text: Stocks are set to slide Monday morning, despite the news of a $900 billion stimulus deal being reached in Washington, due to fears about a new Covid-19 variant. Airlines, cruise lines and hotels are being hit particularly hard while shares of video conferencing firm Zoom, the company that is the poster child for the work from home economy, rallied. Big banks stocks like JPMorgan Chase were also heading higher after the Federal Reserve gave them the green light late Friday to boost stock buybacks and dividends. And shares of Tesla are slipping along with the broader market as Elon Musk's company makes it formal debut in the S&P 500.

Post's Title: Lockdowns have stopped people moving. And fugitives are running out of hiding places
Post's Text: As Covid-19 restrictions tightened in China early this year, a fugitive who had been on the run for four years after allegedly stealing a corpse was running out of places to hide

Post's Title: White House vaccine chief explains why states haven't received number of vaccines promised
Post's Text: The chief scientific adviser for Operation Warp Speed explained that an unpredicted "two-day lag period" is the reason why many states have not received the number of vaccines promised

Post's Title: Doctor who tested Covid-19 vaccines on a thousand volunteers finally gets his shot
Post's Text: Every time Dr. Paul Bradley goes into an exam room, he wonders: Will today be the day he gets Covid-19? Last week it was finally time for him to roll up his own sleeve and get the Pfizer vaccine.

Post's Title: Congress leaves state and local governments facing gaping budget holes
Post's Text: It's looking less and less likely that the coronavirus relief package being hammered out on Capitol Hill will contain aid for states.

Post's Title: An Arkansas woman was only expected to live a few hours after being taken off a ventilator. Instead, the Covid-19 patient smiled and tried to wave
Post's Text: Rhonda Withem's family was ready to say goodbye as the Covid patient was taken off her ventilator. Then she smiled. Now her family says she's getting stronger and stronger each day.

Post's Title: Farmers gather to protest agricultural laws in India amid cold and Covid-19
Post's Text: Go There heads to India as tens of thousands of farmers have swarmed outside New Delhi in cold temperatures to protest new agricultural laws they say could destroy their livelihoods. Additional protests have even been held across the globe in solidarity.   But New Delhi is a Covid-19 hotspot, and the dense, maskless demonstrations could cause another spike in coronavirus cases, putting further strain on an already overwhelmed health care system. CNN’s Vedika Sud reports.

Post's Title: CDC warns of a 'substantial increase' in fatal drug overdoses coinciding with the Covid-19 pandemic
Post's Text: The worst of the deaths coincide with closures and other measures taken to control the pandemic, the CDC said in a health alert

Post's Title: Bidens to receive first dose of Pfizer vaccine Monday
Post's Text: President-elect Joe Biden and incoming first lady Jill Biden will receive the first dose of the Pfizer vaccine on Monday

Post's Title: Timeline Photos
Post's Text: The covid vaccines are ready, but are you ready to take one? Join Don Lemon and Dr. Sanjay Gupta for The Color of Covid – The Vaccines. Tonight at 10 p.m. ET on CNN

Post's Title: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta received his Covid-19 vaccine on live TV this morning
Post's Text: CNN chief medical correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta and Dr. Valerie Montgomery Rice received the first dose of their Covid-19 vaccine at Grady Memorial Hospital in Atlanta.  After getting the shot, Gupta — who is a practicing surgeon and works in the operation room weekly — said it felt like a "significant" moment.  https://cnn.it/3akOjQk

Post's Title: When Black people are wary of vaccine, it's important to listen and understand why | Opinion
Post's Text: "Black people’s distrust of vaccines — and even at times health care — goes much deeper than the Tuskegee study," writes Tina Sacks for CNN Opinion. "We live in a country organized around structural racism. This means Black Americans are less likely to receive the health care we deserve."

Post's Title: Coca-Cola is cutting 2,200 jobs
Post's Text: Coca-Cola is planning to cut 2,200 jobs, including 1,200 in the United States, as it faces declining sales during the pandemic

Post's Title: Covid-19 Vaccines: Dr. Gupta takes your questions
Post's Text: A critical care nurse was among the first people in the United States to get a shot of the coronavirus vaccine Monday, providing a glimmer of hope nearly a year into the worsening pandemic. But while millions of health care workers may get immunized before the end of the year, the rest of the population will have to wait for months. CNN’s Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta is answering your vaccine questions. Leave them below.

Post's Title: AOC says there is 'urgency of trying to get as much as we can right now' in stimulus talks
Post's Text: New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez said there is "urgency" to try to get as much included in coronavirus stimulus talks because it could be the last chance for a meaningful relief bill if Democrats do not control the Senate once President-elect Joe Biden takes office

Post's Title: French President Emmanuel Macron tests positive for Covid-19
Post's Text: JUST IN: French President Emmanuel Macron has tested positive for Covid-19 after displaying symptoms, his office announces

Post's Title: Florida nursing home and assisted care residents start getting vaccinated against Covid-19
Post's Text: After Covid-19 ravaged nursing homes nationwide, claiming victims without loved ones nearby, seniors at a long-term care facility in Florida started getting vaccinated Wednesday

Post's Title: She was demoted, doubted and rejected. Now, her work is the basis of the Covid-19 vaccine
Post's Text: She stuck with it

Post's Title: Iran grapples with Covid-19 as US sanctions make it harder to treat patients
Post's Text: Go There heads to Iran, where fighting Covid-19 has been extremely challenging for doctors. The country has recorded over a million coronavirus cases and more than 52,000 deaths, as access to essential medicines and medical equipment remains limited under renewed US sanctions and President Trump’s “maximum pressure” campaign. CNN’s Nick Paton Walsh reports from Tehran.

Post's Title: Alaska health worker has allergic reaction to Covid-19 vaccine
Post's Text: The case is the first allergic reaction to the vaccine to be reported in the US, although health officials said they are expecting the occasional allergic reaction — and are prepared to treat anyone suffering from one

Post's Title: Dawn Wells, Mary Ann on 'Gilligan's Island,' dies of Covid-19 complications at 82
Post's Text: JUST IN: "Gilligan's Island" actress Dawn Wells, who played the loveable castaway Mary Ann Summers, has died from Covid-19 complications. She was 82.

Post's Title: They did everything right. But after one at-home haircut, a husband and wife died of Covid-19
Post's Text: Their son hopes his family's grief serves as an important reminder of how easy it can be to contract Covid-19

Post's Title: From rent to canned goods, here's what CNN readers plan to spend their relief payments on
Post's Text: For millions of Americans who lost their jobs or saw their work hours drastically reduced as a result of the coronavirus pandemic, money buys time. Yet, the upcoming direct relief payments from the latest Covid relief package won't buy them much time.

Post's Title: Veterans nursing home where at least 76 died of Covid-19 administers its first vaccines
Post's Text: "I am very happy about getting the vaccine. My wish is that everyone in the world can get the vaccine," said Robert Aucoin, a 78-year-old US Air Force veteran, who received the first Covid-19 shot at the Holyoke Soldiers' Home

Post's Title: Wildfires, Iran, Coronavirus, and More: How the World Changed in 2020
Post's Text: A year that started with wildfires blazing through Australia and escalating tensions between the US and Iran took an unforgettable turn when Covid-19 began to spread. As 2020 comes to a close, CNN takes a look at some of the major global events that shook the world this year.

Post's Title: US air travel hits highest level since start of the pandemic
Post's Text: The TSA screened a record number of people at airports nationwide on Sunday. 1.2 million people passed through security checkpoints, the highest level of air travel since March 15. CNN’s Adrienne Broaddus is at O’Hare Airport in Chicago, one of the busiest airports in the country. What questions do you have for her?

Post's Title: Muslim and Jewish paramedics pause to pray together. One of many inspiring moments in the coronavirus crisis
Post's Text: These two paramedics took a break to pray together, one in the direction of Mecca, the other toward Jerusalem

Post's Title: Wombats, snails, ferrets: The animals that brought us joy during the pandemic
Post's Text: Emily Small and her mother run a nonprofit that cares for injured or orphaned wombats. But when Melbourne, Australia, went into its second lockdown in July, Small had no choice but to hunker down in her one-bedroom apartment — and bring four wombats, most less than a year old.

Post's Title: Trump's plans to sign relief bill on Christmas Eve were scrapped last minute
Post's Text: On Christmas Eve, staff at Mar-a-Lago made preparations for President Donald J. Trump to sign the Covid-19 relief package and government funding bill. But the plan was scrapped at the last minute, two sources with knowledge of the circumstances say.

Post's Title: Fauci shares Biden's concern that 'darkest days' may be ahead in Covid-19 pandemic
Post's Text: "We are really at a very critical point," Dr. Anthony Fauci says. "So I share the concern of President-elect Biden that as we get into the next few weeks, it might actually get worse."

Post's Title: Unemployment benefits lapse for jobless Americans as Trump holds out on signing relief bill
Post's Text: President Donald J. Trump has not signed Congress' latest Covid relief bill, allowing unemployment benefits to lapse for many jobless Americans.

Post's Title: A preschool teacher who was laid off after 20 years won a $250,000 lottery
Post's Text: After working as a preschool teacher in Charlotte, North Carolina, for two decades, Joe Camp was laid off in September amid the coronavirus pandemic. Soon after, he lost his father. But just when he thought life couldn't get any worse, he won the lottery.

Post's Title: Beyoncé to donate $500,000 to people impacted by the eviction crisis
Post's Text: Beyoncé will offer $5,000 grants to help 100 people facing foreclosures or evictions due to the housing crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Post's Title: Covid-19 is now on every continent as Antarctica records its first outbreak
Post's Text: Until this week, Antarctica was the last continent free from the novel coronavirus' grip

Post's Title: Queen Elizabeth says 'you are not alone' in annual Christmas speech
Post's Text: Britain's Queen Elizabeth has commended frontline workers for their efforts during the Covid-19 pandemic, expressing during her annual Christmas television broadcast how "moved" she was by the "quiet, indomitable spirit" shown by people over the last year.

Post's Title: Parents remember their six-year-old who they lost to coronavirus
Post's Text: “I came home to two ambulances, fire trucks, police cars .... and my daughter dead.”  6-year-old Gigi’s parents went out to get her popsicles after the doctor told them she probably had a stomach bug. By the time they returned, she had succumbed to Covid-19. https://cnn.it/3bv2i4Y

Post's Title: Japan appoints Minister for Loneliness to combat rising suicide rate
Post's Text: Japan's suicide rate increased for the first time in 11 years during the Covid-19 pandemic

Post's Text: Vaccine advisers to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration will meet Friday to discuss whether to recommend Johnson & Johnson's Covid-19 vaccine for emergency use authorization. It would be the first single-dose Covid-19 shot available in the US.

Post's Title: Trump urges Americans to get Covid-19 vaccine: 'I would recommend it'

Post's Title: More than 500 people in UK put on 'Do Not Resuscitate' orders without consent, study says

Post's Title: After you're vaccinated, it's critical to keep masking up in many places (for now). Here's why
